intro: Bikkia palauensis, commonly known as the Palau starling plant, is a flowering plant native to the island nation of Palau in the Western Pacific. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
